title: Review: 'Curious Savage' a solid play at MCT
text:
Review: 'Curious Savage' a solid play at MCT Liz Lark-Riley, For FLORIDA TODAY 4:16 p.m. EDT October 11, 2015 "Curious Savage" will be playing at Melbourne Civic Theatre from Oct. 2-Nov. 8. By Heath Chapman and Tim Walters Posted Sept. 24, 2015 Comedy on stage in Melbourne weekends through Nov. 8. Buy Photo Reading the New Yor Times is Susan Suomi, as "Mrs. Savage". Dress rehearsals for "The Curious Savage" playing at the Melbourne Civic Theatre from Oct. 2 to Nov.8. For tickets, call (321) 723-6935 or go to mymct.org. (Photo: TIM SHORTT/FLORIDA TODAY) Buy Photo 84 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
I have nothing but praise to lavish upon Melbourne Civic Theatre’s current offering, "The Curious Savage." I advise you to stop reading this moment and call the box office for tickets; MCT’s intimate house can only accommodate so many and you don’t want to be left out. 
"The Curious Savage" by John Patrick premiered 65 years ago in New York, and it’s not difficult to see why is has withstood the test of time. At once funny and poignant, screwball and incredibly smart, the script is nearly flawless. 
The action takes place in the common room of a mental health facility called the Cloisters where five patients are anxiously awaiting a new arrival, Mrs. Ethel P. Savage. Savage is a very wealthy widow whose stepchildren are trying to commit her for her eccentric and philanthropic ideas of what to do with the $10 million left to her by their father. 
Story continues below Buy Photo Susan Suomi, as "Mrs. Savage", and Mary Carson Wouters, as "LillieBelle" . In the background is Steve Costner as "Senator Savage" and David Baum, as "Judge Savage".
